byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes contributed reporting from Las Vegas, and Trip Gabriel from New York.

abstract: Federal government’s expansion of a mortgage refinancing program could reduce monthly payments of up to one million homeowners, but analysts say modest scope of the plan means it will probably do little to heal the housing market or help the broader economy.
snippet: A White House effort could reduce the monthly payments of up to one million homeowners, but analysts said it wouldn’t heal the housing market.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

lead_paragraph: A White House effort could reduce the monthly payments of up to one million homeowners, but analysts said it wouldn’t heal the housing market.

headline.main: Expansion of Mortgage Program Is Limited in Scope
headline.print_headline: Expansion of Mortgage Refinancing Program Is Limited in Scope
